Another example of how structural racism affects conservation comes from Belinda Chin (Mulki 2020, episode 21), coordinator for the Urban Food Systems Program at Seattle Parks and Recreation. Chin explained that through most of her career, White workplace peers often tokenized and dismissed discriminatory acts toward her. Wanting to understand the prejudice of dominant White environmental organizational culture, she started to educate herself on issues of environmental history and environmental justice.
